formattedAddress: 41 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 41 Essex St, New York, NY 10002-4636, USA

originalText.text:
Adorable intimate spot for fun sushi experience! The set up in the back is very cozy and they provide a space to hang jackets. We did the pulsd deal which came with a bottle of wine or sake so the total with tip was $63 each. Completely worth the price!

Our sushi chef was so talented and sweet and introduced each dish to us. One favorite was the fatty tuna. There were generous portions of fish and the chef adjusted the amount of wasabi to guest preferences. It was so cool to see each piece made in front of us. Timing was perfect, we finished the 11 course meal in around an hour and 15 minutes. The miso soup and toasted matcha ice cream were amazing. Dining at 6, it was a little less crowded so would definitely recommend.

originalText.text:
My husband and I stopped by for his birthday dinner in their storage room (back room). It was a painful experience. The chef they hired for sushi omakase had a visible mental health issue. As we are both healthcare professionals, we tried to sympathize at first, but it became threatening at a certain point. The entire hour, he was speaking to himself, mumbling, barely comprehensible. At one point, he said it’s his first night and that’s why he doesn’t know what he’s doing. He didn’t know what any of the fish being served was and said that he normally does vegan cuisine. He would put something on our plate, and take it off to garnish it, and put it back on because he was forgetful. It was chaotic and made us nervous. We tried to stick it through, but the poor man was going off the deep end. I’m not sure why this restaurant hired this man and put him in a poor position as well if he doesn’t have sushi experience.

We stopped our dinner and spoke to the waitress, who moved us to their front of house restaurant fortunately. It saved our night. The food at the front of house was delicious. I really enjoyed the salmon and lamb entrees. The main chef even stopped by the table to apologize. They realized how poor the situation was. The atmosphere was intimate and cute. We appreciated that they switched us over as the alternative would’ve been to step out of dinner from the storage room and get the chef help by calling an ambulance to help him.

Needless to say, I owe my husband a re-do birthday dinner ;)

originalText.text:
Amazing sake bar! Definitely a hidden gem in the lower east side. They have a long list of different range of sake so you can definitely find something you like there. They are also selling hot shochu, perfect for a cold night out.
The vibe is very chill and layback with jazz play in the background. Definitely recommend!

originalText.text: Overpriced. You should expect what you pay for. This is overpriced for the quality. It’s like a regular sushi quality. Not omakase. This money you can just eat either at Shinn East or Doma
